Sequence Information.Source: Synthetic construct(derived from HIV-1 viral protein R (Vpr))
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.17490682]HIV-1:Inhibition of 3′-end processing catalyzed by integrase(IC50=187 µM);inhibition of strand transfer catalyzed by integrase(IC50=41 µM);inhibition of disintegration catalyzed by integrase(IC50=73 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: The viral enzymes RT and IN have cardinal roles in the early stages of the replication of retroviruses and retrotransposons. The peptide derived from viral protein R (Vpr) could inhibit integrase(IN) and thus inhibit the replication of HIV-1.

Literature.Title: Inhibition of the activities of reverse transcriptase and integrase of human immunodeficiency virus type-1 by peptides derived from the homologous viral protein R (Vpr).
Literature.Author: Gleenberg IO, Herschhorn A, Hizi A.
